result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathy A. Koebler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in fully by 10-01-2016 or serve 4 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.  DNA surcharge is waived by the Court.

Straight Time.
STAYED.
Defendant is required to attend the Retail Theft Class on 07-16-2016.  Defendant must provide the Court with certification.
Once certification is received, the Court will permanently stay the jail sentence.
Defendant is to have NO contact with the Pick N Save store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathy A. Koebler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2/14/17 received a letter from DOA-Collections - Kathy Koebler passed away on 10/7/16 - no estate or beyond claim
Certificate of Completion of the Justice Alternattive Court Program.

Letter dated July 18, 2016 filed by defendant requesting to take the next retail theft class to be held on September 17, 2016 with attached letter from the party who was to provide transportation for the defendant.

7/29/16 - Court grants defendant's request; defendant to attend Retail Theft class on 9/17/16 and provide proof to the court by 9/30/16. If proof isn't provided by 9/30/16 then the Court will issue a bench warrant imposing the 60 days jail with 4 days credit.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kathy A. Koebler in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty as to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 dismissed and read in.   
State makes recommendations regarding sentencing.  
Attorney Kees makes statements regarding sentencing. 
Ms Koebler makes statements to the Court. 


The Court Orders the Following:
60 days in the Waukesha County Jail STAYED.  (4 DAYS CREDIT)
Ms Koebler is required to attend the Retail Theft Class on 7/16/16 and provide the court with certification.
Once the certification is received, the Court will permanently stay the jail sentence.  

Defendant is to have No contact with the Pick N Save store listed in the criminal complaint.

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  waived by the Court. 

Total costs to be paid by October 1, 2016, alternate for non payment is 4 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Authorization to Appear, received and filed in court.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   
Defendant Kathy A. Koebler did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by Authorization.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Atty. Anna Kees appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Pick N Save Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

ADDRESS INFO for Kathy A. Koebler
Current: 337 N. West Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 04-18-2016)
Prior: 1305 Cleveland Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant Kathy A. Koebler in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Kathy A. Koebler not in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
